protocol_num.caption: Protocol Number
protocol_num.description: The TCP/IP protocol number, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). Use -1 if the protocol is not defined by IANA. See Protocol Numbers. For example: 6 for TCP and 17 for UDP.

tcp_flags.caption: TCP Flags
tcp_flags.description: The network connection TCP header flags (i.e., control bits).

http_cookie.caption: HTTP Cookie
http_cookie.name: http_cookie
http_cookie.description: The HTTP Cookie object, also known as a web cookie or browser cookie, contains details and values pertaining to a small piece of data that a server sends to a user's web browser. This data is then stored by the browser and sent back to the server with subsequent requests, allowing the server to remember and track certain information about the user's browsing session or preferences.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The HTTP cookie name.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The path of the HTTP cookie.

secure.caption: Secure
secure.description: The cookie attribute to only send cookies to the server with an encrypted request over the HTTPS protocol.

http_only.caption: HTTP Only
http_only.description: A cookie attribute to make it inaccessible via JavaScript

expiration_time.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time.description: The expiration time of the HTTP cookie.

samesite.caption: SameSite
samesite.description: The cookie attribute that lets servers specify whether/when cookies are sent with cross-site requests. Values are: Strict, Lax or None

expiration_time_dt.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time_dt.description: The expiration time of the HTTP cookie.

network_interface.caption: Network Interface
network_interface.name: network_interface
network_interface.description: The Network Interface object describes the type and associated attributes of a network interface.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the network interface.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of network interface.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address associated with the network interface.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The hostname associated with the network interface.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier for the network interface.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The MAC address of the network interface.

namespace.caption: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace is useful in merger or acquisition situations. For example, when similar entities exists that you need to keep separate.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

subnet_prefix.caption: Subnet Prefix Length
subnet_prefix.description: The subnet prefix length determines the number of bits used to represent the network part of the IP address. The remaining bits are reserved for identifying individual hosts within that subnet.

display.caption: Display
display.name: display
display.description: The Display object contains information about the physical or virtual display connected to a computer system.

physical_height.caption: Physical Height
physical_height.description: The numeric physical height of display.

physical_orientation.caption: Physical Orientation
physical_orientation.description: The numeric physical orientation of display.

physical_width.caption: Physical Width
physical_width.description: The numeric physical width of display.

scale_factor.caption: Scale Factor
scale_factor.description: The numeric scale factor of display.

os.caption: Operating System (OS)
os.name: os
os.description: The Operating System (OS) object describes characteristics of an OS, such as Linux or Windows. Defined by D3FEND d3f:OperatingSystem.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The operating system name.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the operating system.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the OS running on the device that originated the event. For example: "Windows 10", "OS X 10.7", or "iOS 9".

country.caption: Country
country.description: The operating system country code, as defined by the ISO 3166-1 standard (Alpha-2 code). For the complete list of country codes, see ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type identifier of the operating system.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

lang.caption: Language
lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: en (English), de (German), or fr (French).

cpu_bits.caption: CPU Bits
cpu_bits.description: The cpu architecture, the number of bits used for addressing in memory. For example: 32 or 64.

edition.caption: OS Edition
edition.description: The operating system edition. For example: Professional.

sp_name.caption: OS Service Pack
sp_name.description: The name of the latest Service Pack.

sp_ver.caption: OS Service Pack Version
sp_ver.description: The version number of the latest Service Pack.

session.caption: Session
session.name: session
session.description: The Session object describes details about an authenticated session. e.g. Session Creation Time, Session Issuer. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Session.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the session.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The universally unique identifier of the session.

issuer.caption: Issuer Details
issuer.description: The identifier of the session issuer.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the session was created.

credential_uid.caption: User Credential ID
credential_uid.description: The unique identifier of the user's credential. For example, AWS Access Key ID.

is_remote.caption: Remote
is_remote.description: The indication of whether the session is remote.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the session was created.

authorization.caption: Authorization Result
authorization.name: authorization
authorization.description: The Authorization Result object provides details about the authorization outcome and associated policies related to activity.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Details about the Identity/Access management policies that are applicable.

rpc_interface.caption: RPC Interface
rpc_interface.name: rpc_interface
rpc_interface.description: The RPC Interface represents the remote procedure call interface used in the DCE/RPC session.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the DCE/RPC protocol being used in the session.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The unique identifier of the particular remote procedure or service.

ack_reason.caption: Acknowledgement Reason
ack_reason.description: An integer that provides a reason code or additional information about the acknowledgment result.

ack_result.caption: Acknowledgement Result
ack_result.description: An integer that denotes the acknowledgment result of the DCE/RPC call.

win/registry_key.caption: Registry Key
win/registry_key.name: registry_key
win/registry_key.description: The registry key object describes a Windows registry key. Defined by D3FEND d3f:WindowsRegistryKey.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path to the registry key.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the registry key was last modified.

security_descriptor.caption: Security Descriptor
security_descriptor.description: The security descriptor of the registry key.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the registry key was last modified.

cis_benchmark_result.caption: CIS Benchmark Result
cis_benchmark_result.name: cis_benchmark_result
cis_benchmark_result.description: The CIS Benchmark Result object contains information as defined by the Center for Internet Security (CIS) benchmark result. CIS Benchmarks are a collection of best practices for securely configuring IT systems, software, networks, and cloud infrastructure.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The CIS benchmark name.

remediation.caption: Remediation
remediation.description: The remediation recommendations on how to fix the identified issue(s).

network_proxy.caption: Network Proxy Endpoint
network_proxy.name: network_proxy
network_proxy.description: The Network Proxy Endpoint describes characteristics of a network proxy. Defined by D3FEND d3f:ProxyServer.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The short name of the endpoint.

port.caption: Port
port.description: The port used for communication within the network connection.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address of the endpoint, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The geographical location of the endpoint.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The fully qualified name of the endpoint.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the endpoint.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the endpoint.

instance_uid.caption: Instance ID
instance_uid.description: The unique identifier of a VM instance.

interface_name.caption: Network Interface Name
interface_name.description: The name of the network interface (e.g. eth2).

interface_uid.caption: Network Interface ID
interface_uid.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.

intermediate_ips.caption: Intermediate IP Addresses
intermediate_ips.description: The intermediate IP Addresses. For example, the IP addresses in the HTTP X-Forwarded-For header.

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The service name in service-to-service connections. For example, AWS VPC logs the pkt-src-aws-service and pkt-dst-aws-service fields identify the connection is coming from or going to an AWS service.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

compliance.caption: Compliance
compliance.name: compliance
compliance.description: The Compliance object contains information about compliance requirements related of a finding generated by security tool.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

requirements.caption: Requirements
requirements.description: A list of applicable compliance requirements for which this finding is related to.

status_detail.caption: Status Details
status_detail.description: The status details contains additional information about the event outcome.

kernel.caption: Kernel Resource
kernel.name: kernel
kernel.description: The Kernel Resource object provides information about a specific kernel resource, including its name and type. It describes essential attributes associated with a resource managed by the kernel of an operating system. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Kernel.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the kernel resource.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the kernel resource.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path of the kernel resource.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type of the kernel resource.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

system_call.caption: System Call
system_call.description: The system call that was invoked.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.name: malware
malware.description: The Malware object describes the classification of known malicious software, which is intentionally designed to cause damage to a computer, server, client, or computer network.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The malware name, as reported by the detection engine.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The filesystem path of the malware that was observed.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The malware unique identifier, as reported by the detection engine. For example a virus id or an IPS signature id.

classification_ids.caption: Classification IDs
classification_ids.description: The list of normalized identifiers of the malware classifications. Reference: STIX Malware Types

classifications.caption: Classifications
classifications.description: The list of malware classifications, normalized to the captions of the classification_id values. In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

cves.caption: CVE List
cves.description: List of Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE).

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The provider of the malware information.

win/registry_value.caption: Registry Value
win/registry_value.name: registry_value
win/registry_value.description: The registry value object describes a Windows registry value.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The data of the registry value.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the registry value.

type.caption: Type
type.description: A string representation of the value type as specified in Registry Value Types.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path to the registry key, where the value is located.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

is_default.caption: Default Value
is_default.description: The indication of whether the value is from a default value name. For example, the value name could be missing.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the registry value was last modified.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the registry value was last modified.

cvss.caption: CVSS Score
cvss.name: cvss
cvss.description: The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) object provides a way to capture the principal characteristics of a vulnerability and produce a numerical score reflecting its severity.

depth.caption: CVSS Depth
depth.description: The CVSS depth represents a depth of the equation used to calculate CVSS score.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description:
The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) Qualitative Severity Rating. A textual representation of the numeric score.

CVSS v2.0
  • Low (0.0 – 3.9)
  • Medium (4.0 – 6.9)
  • High (7.0 – 10.0)

CVSS v3.0
  • None (0.0)
  • Low (0.1 - 3.9)
  • Medium (4.0 - 6.9)
  • High (7.0 - 8.9)
  • Critical (9.0 - 10.0)

base_score.caption: Base Score
base_score.description: The CVSS base score. For example: 9.1.

metrics.caption: Metrics
metrics.description: The Common Vulnerability Scoring System metrics.This attribute contains information on the CVE's impact. If the CVE has been analyzed, this attribute will contain any CVSSv2 or CVSSv3 information associated with the vulnerability. For example: {{"Access Vector", "Network"}, {"Access Complexity", "Low"}, ...}.

overall_score.caption: Overall Score
overall_score.description: The CVSS overall score, impacted by base, temporal, and environmental metrics. For example: 9.1.

vector_string.caption: Vector String
vector_string.description: The CVSS vector string is a text representation of a set of CVSS metrics. It is commonly used to record or transfer CVSS metric information in a concise form. For example: 3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:H.

email_auth.caption: Email Authentication
email_auth.name: email_auth
email_auth.description: The Email Authentication object describes the Sender Policy Framework (SPF), DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) and Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) attributes of an email.

spf.caption: SPF Status
spf.description: The Sender Policy Framework (SPF) status of the email.

dkim.caption: DKIM Status
dkim.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) status of the email.

dkim_domain.caption: DKIM Domain
dkim_domain.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signing domain of the email.

dkim_signature.caption: DKIM Signature
dkim_signature.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signature used by the sending/receiving system.

dmarc.caption: DMARC Status
dmarc.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) status of the email.

dmarc_override.caption: DMARC Override
dmarc_override.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) override action.

dmarc_policy.caption: DMARC Policy
dmarc_policy.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) policy status.

user.caption: User
user.name: user
user.description: The User object describes the characteristics of a user/person or a security principal. Defined by D3FEND d3f:UserAccount.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The username. For example, janedoe1.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the user. For example, System, AWS IAM User, etc.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The domain where the user is defined. For example: the LDAP or Active Directory domain.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique user identifier. For example, the Windows user SID, ActiveDirectory DN or AWS user ARN.

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit related to the user.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The administrative groups to which the user belongs.

3.caption: System
3.description: System account. For example, Windows computer accounts with a trailing dollar sign ($).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

2.caption: Admin
2.description: Admin/root user account.

full_name.caption: Full Name
full_name.description: The full name of the person, as per the LDAP Common Name attribute (cn).

account.caption: Account
account.description: The user's account or the account associated with the user.

credential_uid.caption: User Credential ID
credential_uid.description: The unique identifier of the user's credential. For example, AWS Access Key ID.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternate user identifier. For example, the Active Directory user GUID or AWS user Principal ID.

kernel_driver.caption: Kernel Extension
kernel_driver.name: kernel_driver
kernel_driver.description: The Kernel Extension object describes a kernel driver that has been loaded or unloaded into the operating system (OS) kernel. Defined by D3FEND d3f:KernelModule.

module.caption: Module
module.name: module
module.description: The Module object describes the load attributes of a module.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The module type.

base_address.caption: Base Address
base_address.description: The memory address where the module was loaded.

function_name.caption: Function Name
function_name.description: The entry-point function of the module. The system calls the entry-point function whenever a process or thread loads or unloads the module.

load_type.caption: Load Type
load_type.description: The load type, normalized to the caption of the load_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. It describes how the module was loaded in memory.

load_type_id.caption: Load Type ID
load_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the load type. It identifies how the module was loaded in memory.

3.caption: ShellCode
3.description: A raw module in process memory that is READWRITE_EXECUTE and had a thread started in its range.

1.caption: Standard
1.description: A normal module loaded by the normal windows loading mechanism i.e. LoadLibrary.

2.caption: Non Standard
2.description: A module loaded in a way avoidant of normal windows procedures. i.e. Bootstrapped Loading/Manual Dll Loading.

4.caption: Mapped
4.description: A memory mapped file, typically created with CreatefileMapping/MapViewOfFile.

5.caption: NonStandard Backed
5.description: A module loaded in a non standard way. However, GetModuleFileName succeeds on this allocation.

start_address.caption: Start Address
start_address.description: The start address of the execution.

cis_control.caption: CIS Control
cis_control.name: cis_control
cis_control.description: The CIS Control contains information as defined by the Center for Internet Security Critical Security Control (CIS CSC). Prioritized set of actions to protect your organization and data from cyber-attack vectors.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The CIS critical security control version.

kill_chain.caption: Kill Chain
kill_chain.name: kill_chain
kill_chain.description: The Kill Chain object represents a single phase of a cyber attack, including the initial reconnaissance and planning stages up to the final objective of the attacker. It provides a detailed description of each phase and its associated activities within the broader context of a cyber attack. See Cyber Kill Chain®.

phase_id.caption: Kill Chain Phase ID
phase_id.description: The cyber kill chain phase identifier.

3.caption: Delivery
3.description: The intruders will use various tactics, such as phishing, infected USB drives, etc.

6.caption: Command & Control
6.description: Malware opens a command channel to enable the intruders to remotely manipulate the victim's system.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The kill chain phase is unknown.

1.caption: Reconnaissance
1.description: The attackers pick a target and perform a detailed analysis, start collecting information (email addresses, conferences information, etc.) and evaluate the victim’s vulnerabilities to determine how to exploit them.

2.caption: Weaponization
2.description: The attackers develop a malware weapon and aim to exploit the discovered vulnerabilities.

4.caption: Exploitation
4.description: The intruders start leveraging vulnerabilities to executed code on the victim’s system.

5.caption: Installation
5.description: The intruders install malware on the victim’s system.

7.caption: Actions on Objectives
7.description: With hands-on keyboard access, intruders accomplish the mission’s goal.

analytic.caption: Analytic
analytic.name: analytic
analytic.description: The Analytic object contains details about the analytic technique used to analyze and derive insights from the data or information that led to the finding or conclusion.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the analytic that generated the finding.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The analytic type.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the analytic that generated the finding.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the analytic that generated the finding.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Describes analytics related to the analytic of a finding or detection as identified by the security product.

account.caption: Account
account.name: account
account.description: The Account object contains details about the account that initiated or performed a specific activity within a system or application.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the account (e.g. GCP Account Name).

type.caption: Type
type.description: The account type, normalized to the caption of 'account_type_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the account (e.g. AWS Account ID).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The account type is not mapped.

product.caption: Product
product.name: product
product.description: The Product object describes characteristics of a software product.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the product.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the product, as defined by the event source. For example: 2013.1.3-beta.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The installation path of the product.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the product.

feature.caption: Feature
feature.description: The feature that reported the event.

lang.caption: Language
lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: en (English), de (German), or fr (French).

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The URL pointing towards the product.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor of the product.

extension.caption: Schema Extension
extension.name: extension
extension.description: The OCSF Schema Extension object provides detailed information about the schema extension used to construct the event. The schema extensions are registered in the extensions.md file.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The schema extension name. For example: dev.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The schema extension version. For example: 1.0.0-alpha.2.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The schema extension unique identifier. For example: 999.

vulnerability.caption: Vulnerability Details
vulnerability.name: vulnerability
vulnerability.description: The Vulnerability Details object describes characteristics of an observed vulnerability.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

cve.caption: CVE
cve.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE).

fix_available.caption: Fix Availability
fix_available.description: Indicates if a fix is available for the reported vulnerability.

kb_articles.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_articles.description: The KB article/s related to the entity

packages.caption: Software Packages
packages.description: List of vulnerable packages as identified by the security product

related_vulnerabilities.caption: Related Vulnerabilities
related_vulnerabilities.description: List of vulnerabilities that are related to this vulnerability.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The vendor who identified the vulnerability.

container.caption: Container
container.name: container
container.description: The Container object describes an instance of a specific container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The container name.

runtime.caption: Runtime
runtime.description: The backend running the container, such as containerd or cri-o.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the container image.

tag.caption: Image Tag
tag.description: The tag used by the container. It can indicate version, format, OS.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The full container unique identifier for this instantiation of the container. For example: ac2ea168264a08f9aaca0dfc82ff3551418dfd22d02b713142a6843caa2f61bf.

image.caption: Image
image.description: The container image used as a template to run the container.

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: Commit hash of image created for docker or the SHA256 hash of the container. For example: 13550340a8681c84c861aac2e5b440161c2b33a3e4f302ac680ca5b686de48de.

network_driver.caption: Network Driver
network_driver.description: The network driver used by the container. For example, bridge, overlay, host, none, etc.

orchestrator.caption: Orchestrator
orchestrator.description: The orchestrator managing the container, such as ECS, EKS, K8s, or OpenShift.

pod_uuid.caption: Pod UUID
pod_uuid.description: The unique identifier of the pod (or equivalent) that the container is executing on.

object.caption: Object
object.name: object
object.description: An unordered collection of attributes. It defines a set of attributes available in all objects. It can be also used as a generic object to log objects that are not otherwise defined by the schema.

datetime_t.caption: Datetime
datetime_t.description: The Internet Date/Time format as defined in RFC-3339. For example 1985-04-12T23:20:50.52Z.

file_hash_t.caption: File Hash
file_hash_t.description: File hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file.

hostname_t.caption: Hostname
hostname_t.description: Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. A domain name in general is an Internet address that can be resolved through the Domain Name System (DNS). For example: r2-d2.example.com.

ip_t.caption: IP Address
ip_t.description: Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

json_t.caption: JSON
json_t.description: Embedded JSON value. A value can be a string, or a number, or true or false or null, or an object or an array. These structures can be nested. See www.json.org.

mac_t.caption: MAC Address
mac_t.description: Media Access Control (MAC) address. For example: 18:36:F3:98:4F:9A.

port_t.caption: Port
port_t.description: The TCP/UDP port number. For example: 80 or 22.

resource_uid_t.caption: Resource UID
resource_uid_t.description: Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.

subnet_t.caption: Subnet
subnet_t.description: Subnet mask in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation. For example 192.168.200.0/24.

timestamp_t.caption: Timestamp
timestamp_t.description: The timestamp format is the number of milliseconds since the Epoch 01/01/1970 00:00:00 UTC. For example 1618524549901.

url_t.caption: URL String
url_t.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) string. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.

base_event.caption: Base Event
base_event.name: base_event

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event, as defined by the event source.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

duration.caption: Duration
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event type name, as defined by the type_uid.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A Class describes the attributes available in an event.

0.caption: Base Event
0.description: The base event is a generic and concrete event. It also defines a set of attributes available in most event classes. As a generic event that does not belong to any event category, it could be used to log events that are not otherwise defined by the schema.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Base Event.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The event data as received from the event source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The event severity is not known.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Details
status_detail.description: The status details contains additional information about the event outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

base_event.description: The base event is a generic and concrete event. It also defines a set of attributes available in most event classes. As a generic event that does not belong to any event category, it could be used to log events that are not otherwise defined by the schema.
